How do I update my address with RBC Direct Investing?

To update your address with RBC Direct Investing, follow these steps:
1. Log in to your RBC Direct Investing account.
2. Navigate to the 'Update Profile' section.
3. Select 'Change your Account Profile' and complete the form with your new address details.
4. Click 'Continue' to submit the request.
5. Note: Ensure to provide your civic address as PO boxes are not accepted.
6. Your address will be updated within 24-48 business hours.
7. If your street/civic address is different from your mailing address or you are unable to update your address online, please call one of our investment services representatives at 1 800 769-2560.
8. To change your address with RBC Royal Bank, submit a separate request through Online Banking. Changes will be reflected with RBC Royal Bank right away.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Update Address](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/adirect/address.html)

How can I transfer funds to or from my RBC Direct Investing account?

To transfer funds between your RBC Direct Investing and RBC Royal Bank accounts, follow these steps:
1. Log in to your RBC Direct Investing account.
2. Go to the 'Funds Transfer' section.
3. Complete the required fields for the transfer.
4. Click 'Submit' to confirm the transaction.
5. Note: transferred funds will not be available for same day settlement. For same day trades you may wish to settle from your 'Bank Account on File' rather than completing a funds transfer.
6. Over the Phone: Contact an investment services representative at 1 800 769-2560 for assistance.
   -  Select Option 3 from the automated telephone service menu and simply follow the prompts
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Transfer Funds](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/adirect/transfer.html)

How do I open an RBC Direct Investing account?

To open an RBC Direct Investing account, follow these steps:
1. By Phone: Complete the application over the phone with a customer service representative at 1-800-769-2560.
2. In Person: Make an appointment with your local RBC Royal Bank branch to complete the application with a Branch Officer.
3. By Internet: Complete the online form through Online Banking and submit it to RBC Direct Investing for review. Alternatively, download and print the application form for completion.
4. To access the application through Online Banking:
   - From your Account Balances page, select 'Investments & retirement'.
   - In the right-hand menu, click on 'Invest with RBC Direct Investing'.
   - Select 'Open an RSP account' or 'Open an Investment Account,' and follow the instructions for completing and submitting the application.
5. Enclose a legible copy of one of the following pieces of identification with your completed application:
   - Valid Passport
   - National Identity Card
   - Drivers License
   - Birth Certificate (if under 21)
   - Government Issued Age of Majority Card
6. Drop off the completed application at any RBC Royal Bank branch or mail it to RBC Direct Investing.
   - Address:   RBC Direct Investing Inc.
                Royal Bank Plaza
                200 Bay Street, North Tower
                P.O. Box 75
                Toronto, ON M5J 2Z5
7. Note: If transferring assets from an existing investment or registered account, include the completed transfer forms with your application for ease of processing.
   - A recent statement from the delivering institution can assist with efficient processing of your transfer request
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Open Account](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/adirect/open.html)

How do I transfer cash or securities to RBC Direct Investing?

To transfer cash or securities to RBC Direct Investing, follow these steps:
1. Complete a Transfer Authorization form and submit it to the institution receiving the transfer.
2. The receiving institution will review the documents for accuracy and coordinate the transfer with the delivering institution.
3. Download a transfer form for Registered, RESP and Investment accounts from the RBC Royal Bank website.
4. Accounts may be transferred in one of the following formats:
   - In cash: All securities indicated will be redeemed by the delivering institution, and a cash value will be forwarded to the receiving institution, usually in the form of a cheque.
   - In kind: All securities indicated will be transferred 'as is'; your holdings at the delivering institution will be transferred exactly as they are currently held, including cash balances.
5. Include the following information on your transfer form:
   - Full name, address, phone number, and SIN number
   - Delivering institution name and address
   - Receiving institution name and address
   - Method of transfer and date and signature of account holder at the delivering institution.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Transfer Cash or Securities](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/adirect/other.html)

How do I withdraw funds from my TFSA?

To withdraw funds from your TFSA, follow these steps:
1. Log in to RBC Online Banking.
2. From the Accounts Summary page, click on your Investment account.
3. On the left-hand side, click on 'Withdraw Investments.'
4. Follow the prompts to complete the withdrawal.
5. Allow up to 2 business days for your balance to update.
6. If unsure about your investments or have questions about your TFSA, call 1-800-463-3863 for assistance.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Withdraw Funds from TFSA](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/search-public/index.html?IR_INTERFACE_ID=5&id=3249&type=6&question=How+do+I+withdraw+funds+from+my+TFSA?)

How do I purchase a GIC online?

To purchase a GIC online, follow these steps:
1. From the Account Balances page, select 'Investments & retirement' from the right-hand 'Research, Purchase & Apply' menu.
2. Select 'Purchase a GIC' from the right-hand Self Service menu.
3. Follow the instructions to complete your purchase.
For existing GICs, follow these steps:
1. Select a GIC from the 'Investments' section of your Account Balances page
2. Follow the prompts to purchase additional GICs online.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Purchase GIC Online](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/gics/purchase.html)

How do I access my RBC Direct Investing account through Online Banking?

To access your RBC Direct Investing account through Online Banking, follow these steps:
1. Log in to your Online Banking account.
2. From the Account Balances page, select one of your RBC Direct Investing accounts or click the 'Go to site' link beside each account.
3. If your RBC Direct Investing account is not currently listed on your Account Balances page, call 1-800-769-2560 for assistance.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Access Account through Online Banking](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/adirect/access.html)

How do I Withdraw from my RRSP?

To withdraw money from your RRSP, follow these steps:
1. Consider whether you really need to withdraw money from your RRSP, as it's not recommended due to tax implications and its impact on your retirement plan.
2. Understand that withdrawals from RRSPs must be declared as income on your tax return at the end of the year, and withholding tax will be deducted from the amount withdrawn.
3. Options for Withdrawal:
   - Call RBC: You can call RBC at any time at 1-800-463-3863 for assistance with the withdrawal process.
   - Visit Branch: Alternatively, you can visit your branch, but it's recommended to call and make an appointment beforehand.
   - Online Banking Message Centre: If the funds are held in the RSP Savings Deposit option or are available in a Guaranteed Investment Certificate (GIC), you can process your withdrawal through the Online Banking message centre. Send a secure message with the withdrawal details, and RBC will take care of it for you.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Open New RRSP](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/rrsps/index.html#3)

How do I contribute to my RRSP online?

To contribute to your RRSP online, follow these steps:
1. Log in to RBC Online Banking.
2. From the Home page, select 'View all account balances' under 'Personal Banking.'
3. Click on your RRSP account from the Account Balances page.
4. Select 'Contribute to this RRSP account' from the Self Service menu.
5. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete your transaction.
6. Review your investor profile online before the deadline for validation.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Contribute to RRSP Online](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/rrsps/index.html#1)

How do I Validate my Investor Profile?

To validate your Investor Profile, follow these steps:
1. Understand that the Investor Profile ensures investment transactions align with your investment objectives, time horizon, and risk tolerance.
2. Note that securities legislation mandates validating your Investor Profile at least once every 12 months.
3. An up-to-date Investor Profile is necessary for conducting mutual fund purchases and switches.
4. Notification Process:
   - Secure Message Centre: Online Banking customers will receive notifications via the secure Message Centre about updating their Investor Profile approximately one month before it's due.
5. Online Transaction Limitations: Transactions that are not compatible with your Investor Profile cannot be completed online.
6. Contact Information:
   - Phone: If a transaction cannot be completed online due to profile compatibility issues, call 1-800-769-2599 and select 'Investments' to review your transaction and Investor Profile.
   - Notification of Transaction Issues: If a transaction cannot be completed for any other reason, you'll be notified during the online transaction process or via email or telephone after the transaction is completed.
Reference: [RBC Direct Investing - Open New RRSP](https://www.rbcroyalbank.com/onlinebanking/bankingusertips/investments/rrsps/index.html#7)
